alert.note: Alert for Frazier Mountain Communities; Grapevine; South End San Joaquin Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 19 at 3:53PM PST until December 21 at 1:00AM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following areas, Bakersfield, Buena Vista, Buttonwillow - Lost Hills - I5, Frazier Mountain Communities, Grapevine, South End San Joaquin Valley, Tehachapi and West Side Mountains South of 198. * WHEN...From Wednesday morning through Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - The heaviest rain that could cause excessive runoff is anticipated to fall Wednesday afternoon into Thursday morning. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Frazier Mountain Communities; Grapevine; South End San Joaquin Valley
